column2: 115.52744745630932 Mukasura https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mukasura Mukasura is an asura (godlike being) in the Mahabharata who attacks Arjuna in the form of a boar
column3: leading to a confrontation between the hero and Shiva disguised as a hunter. The episode later inspired classical literature like Kiratarjuniya and appears in Khmer art depicting Shiva and Arjuna struggling over the slain boar.

column2: 14.053555656916458 Mythical location of the Erymanthian Boars tusks https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erymanthian_boar Heracles’ fourth labour was to capture the Erymanthian boar alive
column3: which he accomplished by driving it into deep snow
column5: and carrying it back to Eurystheus in Mycenae. The inhabitants of Cumae later claimed that tusks kept in the sanctuary of Apollo there were those of the Erymanthian boar
column6: though ancient authors dismissed the assertion as improbable.

column2: 23.14465106077713 Crommyonian Sow https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crommyonian_Sow The Crommyonian Sow was a ferocious pig said to have plagued the area around Crommyon until it was slain by Theseus during his early exploits
column3: and some sources traced its lineage to the monsters Echidna and Typhon. Ancient authors disagreed on its nature—some claiming it was literally a beast
column4: others that “the Sow” was in fact a vicious female bandit nicknamed for her brutish ways. #approx
